userPosition: School choice programs improve education and help disadvantaged students
counterPosition: School vouchers drain public school funding and increase educational inequality
content: Analysis of Louisiana's voucher program found participating students scored 0.4 standard deviations lower in mathâ€”equivalent to losing 2 years of learning. Milwaukee's 30-year voucher program shows no significant achievement gains compared to public schools, while per-pupil spending in remaining public schools declined 23%. Vouchers create 'cream skimming' where motivated families leave, concentrating disadvantage. Private schools accepting vouchers can reject students with disabilities (42% do) and lack transparency requirements. Arizona's universal voucher expansion cost $708M more than projected, with 75% going to families already in private schools. Research from Stanford's CREDO found that charters underperform traditional public schools in 31% of cases, perform equally in 46%, and outperform in only 23%.
